## 1044. KNOW
### Definition
Expresses previous possession of knowledge of a situation; thus, to be separated from (a) acquisition of knowledge — ‘to recognize’, ‘to learn’, ‘to get to know’, etc.; (b) acquaintance with an object/person — ‘to know the way’, ‘to know one’s name’ etc. (as in French connaître). (GLD)

### Contexts
1. What’s happened? I don’t know, maybe he knows. (GLD) 2. Everybody knows that clouds bring rain. (GLD)
